poem:
**Unmet Targets**

A minister's sigh
cuts through morning headlines,
numbers like errant shadows
slipping through grasping fingers.
The promise of 6%
fades like morning mist, 
a reminder:
some hopes unfold
in unpredictable ways, 
fluttering, fragile,
like the early breath
of a life
arriving too soon.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Target for cutting premature birthrate in England will not be met, minister says The women’s health minister has admitted there is no chance the government will meet its target of reducing the premature birthrate to 6% in England by 2025. Preterm birth, when a baby is born before 37 weeks of pregnancy, is the biggest cause of death among children under five in the UK. The previous government set a target in 2019 to reduce". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
